ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: This course needs to be 4 credits. I got a lot out of it, but I had to arrange an incomplete in another class because of the workload in this one. All of the extra labwork required for each class project was very helpful--I'm glad this component was incorporated--but there was no warning ahead of time that this was a requirement, or of the extra time commitment involved. There were a few weeks when I was spending 6 hours/week IN CLASS, in addition to outside reading and working on my independent project. Maybe this is normal for an EEB field/lab based course, but it was extremely difficult for FES students to juggle.
I enjoyed everything about the course very much.
I liked the course
Field trips and individual project
I enjoyed the independent project and learned a lot doing it.
The fact that it is a field course, that you are actually doing ecology, rather than just reading and talking about it. The independent project also provided a great learning experience.
I loved the field trips and lab work.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Maybe a little better planning of the syllabus to line up with actual due dates. Or adjusting the projects rather than pushing back due dates. It ended up not being as front loaded as supposed to be, which made time management more difficult.
This should be at least a 4 credit course given the workload.
The labs were extremely frustrating at times--it would be helpful to spend some time talking about stats and handling large quantities of data.

Better structure, better explanation of theory behind concepts (or brief reviews, as we are meant to have had this background already, although many people didn't), better explanation of experimental design or sampling before going into the field. More clarity about what exactly is required for each lab write-up.Also, students should be given a clearer picture up front of what kinds of lab analyses are available for the independent projects, what kind of a time commitment they involve, and where they can be done so that students can better plan their time.I reiterate, the course needs to be 4 credits!
I loved everything about the course.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: EXCELLENT! Mendy, Lily, and Karin were all awesome. The TFs especially put in so much work and went above and beyond.
All three were very responsive and helpful.
Melinda and the TAs made themselves very available and were very helpful. I really appreciate especially the amount of time the the TAs put into the course.
They were always available.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I have a background in botany but had not yet had the opportunity to do field ecology.
It provided invaluable field and lab experience.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: For hands on learning of ecology.
Desire to gain field and data analysis skills
I wanted to learn more about ecosystem ecology, especially in the field.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes
Yes, I learnt a lot about experiment design, analysis and ecological concepts in general.
Yes
Yes, it did very much so.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes
Yes.
Yes.
Yes, I did.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Although not required, I got a lot out of discussing and thinking through the labs with other students.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Don't underestimate the amount of time the labs take. They are super time intensive even though the write ups are short.
Be prepared to spend four hours a week on field trips, another one hour for class discussion and several more on sampling preparation for the class projects.
Start your independent project early! Come into the course with strong Excel skills and familiarity with a statistical software package.
I would advise students to talk with the professor and TAs often, as they have a wealth of knowledge to share with you.
